# Importing Libraries
import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
%matplotlib inline

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

max_full_vacc = df[df['% of population fully vaccinated'] > 70]

plt.figure(figsize=(10,5))
# make barplot
sns.barplot(x='Country', y="% of population fully vaccinated", data=max_full_vacc, order=max_full_vacc.sort_values('% of population fully vaccinated', ascending = False).Country)
# set labels
plt.xlabel("Countries", size=15)
plt.ylabel("% of population fully vaccinated", size=15)
plt.title("% of population fully vaccinated among all countrues", size=18)
plt.tight_layout()

source.df2e3c7d:
As we can see we have 5 different columns,

1. Country - is our main column since our primary goal is to look at the vaccination trend across various Countries in the world

2. Doses administered per 100 people - For vaccines that require multiple doses, each individual dose is counted. As the same person may receive more than one dose, the number of doses per 100 people can be higher than 100.

3. Total doses administered - 
For vaccines that require multiple doses, each individual dose is counted. As the same person
may receive more than one dose, the number of doses can be higher than the number of
people in the population.

4. % of population vaccinated - means that % of the world population that has received at least one dose

5. % of population fully vaccinated - that have completed both doses for a given vaccine
source.59bd93ae:
These are mostly very small countries, more like Islands

**Now let's compare it with % fully vaccincated**
source.eead4fbd:
**In this Exploratory Analysis, my goal is to find different trends in the vaccination among different countries**

The source for this dataset: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/world/covid-vaccinations-tracker.html

*Note that this analysis was done according to Vaccine Data of all Countries as on August 03, 2021*
source.8bc57b9f: This trend for partially vaccinated and fully vaccinated is the similar for Doses administered per 100 people

**Now let's see Doses administered per 100 people**
source.181ccf8e:
Syria is more partially vaccinated among them 

**Let's see which one has more Total doses administered**
source.b1322bda:
It is quite clear that most countries with low vaccination percentage are the ones that have a poor economy, these mostly include African Countries

**Among them, let's see how many are more partially vaccnated**

Among the lowest number of doses administered, Saint Lucia has the highest % fully vaccnated

source.9e3357fa:
Serra Leone and Mainland China have no values in both fully or partially vaccinated, but I did some research and found that according to https://ourworldindata.org/covid-vaccinations?country=CHN 

China has 16% population fully vaccinated and 28% partially vacinated, now the reason our dataset might not have this value is because maybe (and this is just from my understanding) USA and other countries do not consider the Chinese vaccine even though WHO has given the green light to the two Chinese vaccines, made by Sinovac and Sinopharm. Or maybe China has not shared their stats related to how much of their population is vaccinated. 

What's important to note is that as we've seen above that China has more 'Doses administered per 100 people' which misleads us that 0% of their population is vaccinated and this is further confirmed by the 'Total doses administered' column where China has a higher number.

As all other countries except China in the column above are African, these countries do not have enough facilities to push the vaccination process forward, so are still far behind most countries

Serria Leone has no track of their population partially vaccinated but yet manages to get 2.9 doses administered per 100 people

"Sierra Leone has today received the second batch of 96,000 doses of the AstraZeneca-Oxford COVID-19 vaccine donated by France and delivered by UNICEF through the COVAX Facility" according to this news site: https://www.africanews.com/2021/08/09/coronavirus-sierra-leone-welcomes-the-arrival-of-covid-19-vaccines-shipped-via-covax-facility/
. As of now there is an increase in the number of COVID cases over there, and this is due to less availability of vaccinations accross the country

Hungary as we've seen before has no values for doses but still shows a higher % of vaccinated population.

Pakistan shows 0% partially vaccinated but 3% fully vaccinated population, according to this post:
https://www.business-standard.com/article/current-affairs/only-3-5-of-pakistan-s-population-vaccinated-against-covid-so-far-report-121070700081_1.html
There is a 14% partially vaccinated population in Pakistan
source.e5025f6c:
**1. Top Fully vaccinated Countries**
Highest rate: 76%
Highest Fully vaccinated Countries: Malta and U.A.E 
These were above the 70% rate
Among the top 50% there were mostly countries with smaller area and a good economy
Total doses administered among them were high for countries with a larger population like Germany and U.K 
More doses per 100 people were again higher for countries with low area and population like U.A.E

Note: United States, the manufacturer of the two most trusted vaccinations agaisnt COVID-19, Pfizer and Moderna, is nowhere to be seen in this category.

**2. Top Partially Vaccinated**
Highest rate: 80%
Almost the same countries that were fully vaccinated are also the top partially vaccnated as well, this time United States also makes it way in the top 50%
Among these partially vaccinated, United States has the highest number of doses administered

**3. Top Total doses administered**
Highest number: 1688683000
China has this highest number and the difference between the second highest country is quite large
Among these, Chile has more fully and aprtially vaccinated population and more total doses administered

**4. Top Doses administered per 100 people**
The maximum number for Doses administered per 100 people is: 172
This trend is quite similar to that of Top fully vaccinated countries

**5. Lowest fully vaccinated countries**
Lowest Rate: 0.1% (Haiti)
Most countries are African with poor economy
Among these, Vanuatu is more partially vaccnated
Vietnam has more Total doses administered

**6. Lowest Partially vaccinated Countries**
Congo is at the bottom
Among them, Bostwana, Ukraine and Georgia are more fully vaccinated
Bangladesh has more total doses administered

**7. Lowest Total doses administered**
Lowest dose administered: 6576
Haiti is again the at the bottom
Tonga being more fully and partailly vaccinated

**8. Lowest Doses administered per 100 people**
Minimum Dose administered per 100 people: 0.1
Congo is at the bottom, as well as Haiti
They almost have a similar fully vaccinated percentage
but Syria is more partially vaccinated and with more total doses administered
source.e67ddf6a:
Countries with small areas are more liable to have a higher percentage of being fully vaccinated as we can see from the graph above, there are a few exceptions but this shows that population is also a big factor in this analysis


**of these fully vaccinated countries, let's see the total doses administered**
source.f4553000: This is quite different than the total dose administered, although there is no trend here, all of them have a high rate but there's an anomaly with Hungary
source.b672ae44:
There are 11 values that are missing, 'Doses administered per 100 people' and 'Total doses administered' each have one value missing which is not that bad but '% of population vaccinated' and '% of population fully vaccinated' have 3 and 6 values missing which is quite concerning. So it's safe to assume that these countries with missing values did not keep track of their vaccination and therefore are equivalent to getting no vacination at all.


We will use 0 to fill in these columns
source.e4844976:
This confirms that the same countries that are fully vaccinated are also partially vaccinated as well, with an almost similar order

**Now let's look the Total doses administered**
source.8910423e:
China has the highest number of Total doses administered, that is at a very high peak, compare to India which comes in at the second number, there is a huge difference. This is due to the fact that China has produced Sinopharm and Sinovac, which have been approved by the World Health Organization (WHO) for emergency use. And based on this it should have a higher percentage of vaccinated population. It is not only using it for it's own population but also sending it to other countries as well.

**Based on countries that have highest Total doses administered (more than 50%) let's look at the % population fully vaccinated**
source.e7d43e0f:
'Malta' is the most fully vaccinated country in the world with U.A.E at the second, these cross the 70% mark making them safer among other countries 

Also one can argue that with a population of about 515,000 over an area of 316 km2 (122 sq mi), Malta is the world's tenth smallest country in area, therefore it was easy to have more people be fully vaccinated but we should also consider the fact that it is the fourth most densely populated sovereign country so it is more likey for the virus to spread quickly. So they had to get most of their population vaccinated as quickly as possible.

But as of 8/11/21, there are 87 new COVID-19 cases according to: https://timesofmalta.com/articles/view/87-new-covid-19-cases-as-one-patient-dies.892786

U.A.E has even opened travels for countries without requiring people to vaccinate before travelling

**Now let's look at countries that are above the 50% mark**
source.e636d842:
Vietnam and Nigera have more doses administered while being lowest fully vaccinated countries

**Now let's look at the Doses administered per 100 people**

source.93ebe2ab:
As we can see that Chile has the highest percentage of population fully vaccinated while having the hightest number of Total doses administered. Now Malta and UAE are nowhere near to be found, since they do not have a high number of doses administered.

Over 60 per cent of Chileans are fully vaccinated, a higher proportion of the population than the United States, the majority with Sinovac’s CoronaVac.

**Based on countries that have highest Total doses administered (more than 50%) let's look at the % population partially vaccinated**
